thread.title: Drivers, cyclists and pedestrians on shared space roads
thread.title_full: Drivers, cyclists and pedestrians on shared space roads - BBC News

author: BBC
title: Drivers, cyclists and pedestrians on shared space roads
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Drivers, cyclists and pedestrians on shared space roads 15 October 2015 Last updated at 16:21 BST
Drivers, cyclists and pedestrians are put together in some areas with no kerbs or road markings, known as shared spaces - but there are mixed views of how desirable they are.
Reporter Ellie Price spoke to people using one in a west London street, before Andrew Neil heard from Conservative peer Chris Holmes, who has safety concerns, and the street designer Ben Hamilton-Baillie, who backs the concept.
Read more Daily Politics and Sunday Politics highlights of 2015 Coventry's shared space junctions 'safer' 'Shared space' system introduced in Gloucester Tunbridge Wells shared space under consideration
